Torchbox

Oxford Geek Nights #14

| 7:30pm

OGN14 starting earlier!

Following feedback, the OGN14 keynotes will begin at eight o'clock, a full half hour earlier. The rest of the lineup will similarly start and finish that little bit earlier. This should be more convenient for those having to head to homes outside the ring road.

Keynotes

Our confirmed keynotes are:

  • Take a Walk on the Happy Path, by Michael Mahemoff, pattern and strategy wrangler at BT Osmosoft (slides) (video)
  • ErnestMarples.com: what YOU need to do to free the postcode, by Richard Pope, co-founder of the Ernest Marples postcode project

Microslots

These are five-minute "lightning" talks that anyone can volunteer for. They're easy to do: pick something that excites you, or a project you've worked on that you think might be of interest; then talk to a friendly audience for just five minutes with a handful of slides. Submit your microslot and we'll see you on the night!

Currently confirmed microslots:

  • Happy To Help: a social search utility, by Peter Ferne (slides) (video)
  • Estate Agency Two Point Zero, by Kris Northfield (slides) (video)
  • myvcorp, by Anastasios Smeros (slides) (video)
  • Rapid Application Prototyping with Sketchflow, by Viral Tarpara (slides) (video)

Join the mailing list

Oxford Geek Night is a regular meet-up for designers & developers run by Torchbox

We have two keynote talks of 15 minutes each followed by a handful of 5 minute micro-slots.
